sentences.en: A canny bureaucratic infighter , Moorer made no pretense of academic subtlety.
sentences.cn: 穆勒是个机警的官场角逐者, 但他并不装作高深莫测.
官僚主义所致的延误是不可避免的。

sentences.en: Diplomats believe that bureaucratic delays are inevitable.
sentences.cn: 外交官们认为繁文缛节造成的延迟是在所难免的。

sentences.en: Eventually I wearied of the bureaucratic infightings.
sentences.cn: 我终于对官场的勾心斗角感到厌烦了.

sentences.en: In this company you have to go through complex bureaucratic procedures just to get a new pencil.
sentences.cn: 在这个公司里即使是领一支新铅笔,也必须通过繁琐的手续.
又让官僚主义搞成了一团糟。

sentences.en: My effort to broaden the President's choices involved unusual bureaucratic difficulties.
sentences.cn: 我努力让总统有更大的选择余地,这在官僚机构中碰到了非凡的困难.

sentences.en: Nowhere in Britain has bureaucratic centralization proceeded with more pace than in Scotland.
sentences.cn: 在英国，官僚集权化发展最快的就是苏格兰了。

sentences.en: Our negotiating position would reflect not bureaucratic compromise but careful analysis of consequences and objectives.
sentences.cn: 我们的谈判立场不仅要反映官方的和解态度,而且要反映对后果和目标的精心分析.

sentences.en: The asylum seekers had to contend with continued bureaucratic obstruction.
sentences.cn: 寻求政治庇护的人得不断地应付官僚主义的层层阻挠.

sentences.en: The department has become a bureaucratic nightmare.
sentences.cn: 该部门的官僚作风非常严重。

sentences.en: The little money that was available was tied up in bureaucratic red tape.
sentences.cn: 能用的那点儿小钱被繁文缛节拖得遥遥无期。

sentences.en: The prison official is icily polite and bureaucratic.
sentences.cn: 监狱官冷淡又客气，表现出十足的官僚作风。

sentences.en: The result in many cases was bureaucratic chaos.
sentences.cn: 结果在许多地方,促成了官僚主义的横行.

sentences.en: The sweat of labour washed away his bureaucratic [ official ] airs .
sentences.cn: 劳动的汗水冲掉了他身上的 官气.

sentences.en: They have decentralised the company and made it less bureaucratic.
sentences.cn: 他们已经分解了该公司的权力，以抑制其官僚作风。

words.tran_cn: 官僚主义；官僚机构；官僚政治

trans.tran_en: involving a lot of complicated official rules and processes
